column4: hi! a using Firestarter, i can't internet doesn't reach the other pc in my network.. help please?
sorry mistyped hi! am using firestarter, can't seem to share my internet ...
you gotta do a couple things,
first, make sure that everything is networking properly,
if you set DHCP to on, it will assign a 'gateway' ip to your local network interface,
then assign ip's in that same subnet to the other computers
i'm talking about networking in the sense of IP addressing
what needs to happen: you need to be able to ping the shared computer, and vice-versa
firestarter has a problem with static addressing, so you have to mangle the ipTables rules....
what you are interested in is what iptables has in it's FORWARD table
you should see a bunch of stuff in after INPUT, OUTPUT, INBOUND, OUTBOUND, LSI, and LSO
what you want is what's after FORWARD
for ex, mine says "-A FORWARD -p icmp -m limit --limit 10/sec -j ACCEPT"
